question: Which of the following type of Kidneys is found in an adult frog?
explanation: Mesonephros is permanent kidney of frog and most fish, developing posterior to and replacing the pronephros of the embryonic and larval stages. It is a paired organ consisting of a set of nephrons having capsules that filter blood from the glomerulus and tubules whose cells reabsorb water and nutrients and secrete nitrogenous wastes.
